articles.title: Mechanisms of Psychedelic-Induced Neuroplasticity in Depression Treatment
key_findings: 5-HT2A receptor activation increases BDNF expression by 340%
Dendritic spine density increases persist for 30+ days post-treatment
articles.ai_analysis_summary: Critical mechanistic insights for psychedelic antidepressant development. High confidence in neuroplasticity pathway validation.
articles.patent_implications: Mechanism-based claims possible for neuroplasticity enhancement
articles.regulatory_relevance: Supports efficacy rationale for FDA submissions

articles.title: NMDA Receptor Subtype Selectivity in Rapid Antidepressant Action
key_findings: GluN2B-selective antagonism sufficient for antidepressant effects
GluN2A antagonism associated with dissociative side effects
Subtype selectivity ratio >10:1 optimal for therapeutic window
articles.ai_analysis_summary: Definitive evidence for NMDA subtype selectivity in antidepressant development. Critical for next-generation ketamine analogs.
articles.patent_implications: Subtype-selective compounds represent significant IP opportunity
articles.regulatory_relevance: Supports differentiation strategy for improved ketamine analogs

articles.title: MDMA-Assisted Psychotherapy for Severe PTSD: Phase 3 Results
key_findings: 67% of patients no longer met PTSD criteria vs 32% placebo
Serious adverse events <2% and manageable in clinical setting
articles.ai_analysis_summary: Landmark clinical evidence for MDMA-assisted psychotherapy. Regulatory approval highly likely based on these results.
articles.patent_implications: Method of use patents for PTSD treatment provide market exclusivity
articles.regulatory_relevance: Primary evidence package for FDA approval submission

articles.title: Biased Opioid Receptor Signaling: Separating Analgesia from Respiratory Depression
key_findings: G-protein biased agonists reduce respiratory depression by 75%
Analgesic efficacy maintained with bias factor >5
Reduced tolerance development in chronic dosing studies
articles.ai_analysis_summary: Strong evidence for biased signaling approach to safer opioids. Multiple development opportunities identified.
articles.patent_implications: Biased agonist compositions and methods represent major IP opportunity
articles.regulatory_relevance: Supports safety differentiation for next-generation opioids

articles.title: GABA-A Receptor Subtype Selectivity and Anxiolytic Efficacy Without Sedation
articles.journal: Journal of Pharmacology and Experimental Therapeutics
key_findings: α2/α3-selective modulators provide anxiolysis without sedation
No tolerance development with subtype-selective compounds
Preserved cognitive function in all preclinical models
articles.ai_analysis_summary: Clear pathway to improved benzodiazepines through subtype selectivity. High development potential.
articles.patent_implications: Subtype-selective GABA-A modulators represent significant IP opportunity
articles.regulatory_relevance: Supports development of improved anxiety medications
